name: HIV Support web application
description: HIV Support is a case manager dedicated to support CSOs who receive help requests from refugees with HIV who seek help to continue treatment and to access other services relevant for their condition.

sdgs.relevance: SDG 3: The solution enables access to healthcare service and medication for people living with HIV in case they are taking refuge from the war in Ukraine. The solution is agnostic of geography and can be redeployed for any need of case management for this specific type of condition. The solution can be adapted with custom forms and the content on the public interface can be easily changed with no need for technical support. This type of digital solution is essential in the case of displaced populations as it allows them to request aid fast and easy for their medical needs and first responders can get a clear view of what availability exists to support them and provide them with. The platform is multilingual and allows for multiple interfaces for as many languages as needed with no need for extra development. A standard deployment in any use case would take under 24 hours.

clearOwnership.clearOwnershipURL: Each of the solutions developed by Commit Global (or any of its local branches such as Code for Romania) are open source under the MPL 2.0 license. The About section of the Romanian deployment currently active can be read here https://consilierehiv.ro/en/about-us

documentation:
The deployment documentation is available in the Github repository. 
There are several documents that describe the specific fields and input types for  thedeployment currently active in Romania, however, the application allows for custom forms and specific rule definitions depending on the use case. The public interface is a custom redeployment of another owned open-source solution, Website Factory.

bestPractices: The development of the solution has followed a set of best practices such as documentation of the process
code refactoring and rapid application development. We have followed UX design rules and principles
the solution is modular and maintainable
it is very reusable and has been built on the scaffolding of a previous open-source solution
manages security and consented access thoroughly. The solution also respects our internal standards for open-source development that stipulate best practices in terms of data management

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
typesOfPIIDataCollected: We collect data such as email

phone and info about medical diagnoses. The data is used solely by the administrator of the platform to provide refugees with requested support and nobody has access to this information outside the designated administrator.
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity:
The security measures set in place are: 
- strong password rules 
- permission-based access 
- dedicated infrastructure, isolated form other apps 
- encrypted data storage 
- encrypted backups
